lines.text: I need, I say, I need a pointer, and that dog's got just the head for it, pointed, that is.
[after ringing the bell, the very first time, the smaller chick makes signs, and quickly squawks to Barnyard Dog of seeing a fox, but it is mis-understood]
Oh, I get it. Come on, I'll take you.
[Barnyard Dog then speaks to the audience]
Heh, heh, heh, heh. The little fellow wanted a drink of water.

[Dressed in a suit, almost like a brown and white tuxedo]
Hey bud, come here!
Huh? Who, me?
Yeah. Come here. Where you going?
Why I'm, why I'm a going fishing.
Uh-huh.
Un-huh?
Un-huh.
You got a hunting dog?
Why, yes.
Get him, and go hunting.
Well bow, well bow my weavel, I'll do it.

And our next contestant is ready, to try for the sixty-four million dollars. Careful now, here's the question. What poem mentions the colors, red and blue? When you come to the words red and blue, press the buzzer, you have in the booth.
[Foghorn Leghorn deeply concentrates]
Time's up. Do you know the answer?
Why, man, yes. Roses are red, I say roses are red.

[Foghorn Leghorn then pressed the buzzer that detonated a stick of dynamite in Barnyard Dog's mouth, he then lost a left molar tooth, then spat out the remnant of the stick out of his mouth, proving that he had just lost a tooth. After the severe injury, Barnyard Dog took the other stick of dynamite, both were secretly & quietly put in his mouth, by the continuous trouble-making fox & put the second stick of dynamite in Foghorn Leghorn's beak, then completed the conclusion of the disguised fox's question of the red & blue question, the fox asked Foghorn Leghorn, approximately ten seconds earlier]

[bitterly]
And violets are blue!
[after pressing buzzer, detonating other stick of dynamite, in Foghorn Leghorn's beak, injuring Foghorn Loghorn, much like him, losing a majority his feathers]

[very weakly]
Somebody, I say somebody knocked.

[speaking extremely quick and getting Barnyard Dog, off guard]
Here, boy. Get the bone, get the bone, get the bone. Go! Go! Go! get it! Get it! Go!

[Fox lead Barnyard Dog, that was asleep, into chasing a stick, that landed, in a trap, just set by the fox. After tricking Barnyard Dog, the fox then quickly folded up box, locking up and trapping Barnyard Dog]

[Fox, is now dressed as a genie, and attracts Foghorn Leghorn's attention, as Foghorn Leghorn is walking and singing, to to a place for fishing]
Uh, what do we have here?

[speaking with French accent]
A lucky charm, off-ende to help you catch lots of fish. Only ten dollar.
Lucky charm?
Very lucky.
Lots of fish?
Great quantities.
It's a deal.
Thank you, off-ende. Just blow on it three times and throw it, over your left shoulder.
Hmm, lots of fish eh?
[Foghorn Leghorn then blew on it and then tossed, trapped Barnyard Dog, into well, not knowing Barnyard Dog was trapped in it]

[after seeing Barnyard Dog, injured again and singing]
What happened to you dog? You look like two miles of bad road.
What you doing there, Dog?
[getting even, Barnyard Dog folded up Foghorn Leghorn, blew on his folded up body three times and tossed him, over left shoulder and in the same well]

[Foghorn Leghorn just climbed out of well and dried himself]
Hold on, dog. How come you do me like you do-do-do?
Because you've been trying to keep me from my job, Guarding the chickens.
Why, I dont want to keep you from guarding the chickens.
Well, somebody does.
And I think I know who that somebody is. Look!
[Foghorn Leghorn sees the fox and points it to Barnyard dog]
Why that no good...
[Foghorn Leghorn stopped Barnyard Dog, from speaking, so Foghorn Leghorn could give him a different suggestion of advice]
Whoa! Back-up boy. I've got a little o' idea. Come on.
[after Foghorn Leghorn spoke, the small chick rang the warning bell]

[in unison, Foghorn Leghorn and Barnyard Dog spoke]
Hey, bud. Come here.
Who, me?

[in unison, Foghorn Leghorn & Barnyard Dog speak]
Yeah. Where you going?
[fox, dazed talks with gibberish voice]

[In Unison]
Un-huh!
[Foghorn Leghorn and Barnyard Dog quickly make a duel, making the fox, their target. The fox being shot twice, was shot once by each, then runs away]

[dressed like a fox hunting executive, setting on Barnyard Dog's back, Foghorn Leghorn blows a bugle]
We fixed that fox, and that's only the beginning.
[after this is small chick with final line, saying Un-huh! then showing newspaper with THE END, written, on other side]
